> This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Despite this promise, I see bors idling so I will manually send it again.

bors merge
Already running a review

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7964304291/job/21741565775)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7964304291/job/21741565345)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7964304291/job/21741565650)
Will have a look at the rest tomorrow - but maybe it's cleaner to do the bracket refactor in another PR?
otherwise looking good

hopefully

```suggestion
  smul_mem {s} c _ h := s.smul_mem'  c h
```

or if not

```suggestion
  smul_mem {s} c _ h := s.toSubMulAction.smul_mem' c h
```

but why do we need to do this if we already have a SubMulAction? shouldn't this be getting picked up automatically?

We need it so that the lemma `SetLike.mk_smul_mk` applies to terms involving terms of type `LieSubmodule R L M`.

It's true that we have projections `LieSubmodule.toSubmodule` and `Submodule.toSubMulAction` but we still need a `SMulMemClass` instance indexed on `LieSubmodule R L M` because though these projections exist, it is the type `LieSubmodule R L M` that is used to look up the typeclass instances.

Note that we have the corresponding instance for `Submodule` [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Submodule/Basic.html#Submodule.smulMemClass).

I do however agree that we _shouldn't_ have to write all the boilerplate nonsense.
Does `deriving` deal with this? If not maybe we should write a handler for it.
Yes, I believe this is a job for `deriving` and I think the handler is missing.
this should probably be its own lemma

I don't think it should since this is a weaker version of what we're proving.

However your remark has inspired me to add the result `LieModule.weightSpace_le_weightSpaceChain` and using that I can emphasise my point:
```lean
example [LieAlgebra.IsNilpotent R H] {k : â„¤} (hk : k âˆˆ Ioo p q)
    (hq : weightSpace M (q â€¢ Î± + Ï‡) = âŠ¥)
    {x : L} (hx : x âˆˆ rootSpace H Î±)
    {y : M} (hy : y âˆˆ weightSpace M (k â€¢ Î± + Ï‡)) :
    â…x, yâ† âˆˆ weightSpaceChain M Î± Ï‡ p q :=
  lie_mem_weightSpaceChain_of_weightSpace_eq_bot_right M Î± Ï‡ p q hq hx <|
    weightSpace_le_weightSpaceChain M Î± Ï‡ p q hk hy
```

Sorry I don't think I was clear, I did actually mean `weightSpace_le_weightSpaceChain` - I know it's absolutely clear how `weightSpaceChain` is defined to anyone using it, but I still think we should have the API lemmas instead of forcing people to look though the `biSup`.
OK great, so all is well now?

Yep, just wanted to leave it open to maybe if there was any other Sup lemmas that needed to be included here, but can't think of any.

Let's test this:

maintainer merge
is this explciit characterisation likely to be useful outside the proof? I guess probably not as we're only dealing with pure elements, right?
Yes, I think it unlikely these will be useful outside.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: basic theory of chains of roots / weights of Lie algebras / modules

source.title: The roots of a Lie algebra are a root system.
